newsitem.title: USA: Sears to sell stake in Sears Mexico to Carso.
newsitem.headline: Sears to sell stake in Sears Mexico to Carso.

text.p: Sears Roebuck and Co said Wednesday it would sell a 60 percent stake in its Sears Roebuck de Mexico SA de CV unit to Grupo Carso SA de CV for $103 million, or $2.2889 per share.
The price represents a 40 percent premium over the recent market price of Sears de Mexico shares, Sears said.

"Upon closing of the transaction, Grupo Carso, a leading Mexican diversified conglomerate, will offer to purchase the remaining (Sears de Mexico) shares not owned by Sears at the same price," Sears said.
Sears said it owns 75 percent of Sears Mexico and will retains a 15 percent interest following the sale.
Sears Mexico retains the right to use the Sears name in Mexico under an exclusive license with a five-year initial term, Sears said.

"We are pleased to form an alliance with a strong local partner ... Grupo Carso has clearly signaled its intention to expand the number of Sears outlets, protect the Sears brand and grow the concept in Mexico," Sears Chairman and Chief Executive Arthur Martinez said in a statement.

Sears said it will retain representation on the Sears de Mexico board of directors. It said it expects to take a charge on the transaction in the first quarter, but the charge is not expected to have a material impact on annual earnings.
"The transaction, which is subject to certain conditions, including obtaining all required governmental approvals, is expected to be completed by late April," Sears said.

Grupo Carso has holdings in construction, auto parts, consumer goods and retailing, including the Sanborns chain. With 821 full-line stores, 2,500 off-the-mall stores and 1996 revenues exceeding $38 billion, Sears is one of the world's largest retailers.
